instruments.name: Kelly Hemostatic Forceps
instruments.description: A locking hemostatic forceps commonly used to clamp blood vessels and control bleeding. Features horizontal serrations that extend partially down the jaw length.
instruments.handling_notes: Available in curved and straight varieties. Check ratchet mechanism before use. Pass with rings toward surgeon.

instruments.name: Crile Hemostatic Forceps
instruments.description: Similar to Kelly forceps but with horizontal serrations extending the full length of the jaw for improved grip. Used for clamping larger vessels and tissue bundles.
instruments.handling_notes: Full serrations provide stronger grip than Kelly. Available in 5.5 and 6.25 inch lengths.

instruments.name: Mosquito Hemostatic Forceps
instruments.description: A small, delicate hemostatic forceps with fine tips designed for clamping small blood vessels and delicate tissues. Named for its small, precise jaws.
instruments.handling_notes: Available in curved and straight. Use with care to avoid crushing delicate structures. 5 inch standard length.

instruments.name: Kocher Forceps
instruments.description: Heavy-duty forceps with transverse serrations and interlocking teeth at the tip. Designed for clamping heavy tissue and fascia with a secure grip.
instruments.handling_notes: Teeth can be traumatic - avoid use on delicate tissue or bowel. Available in 5.5 to 9 inch lengths.

instruments.name: Allis Tissue Forceps
instruments.description: Grasping forceps with multiple interlocking teeth at the tip. Used to grasp tissue firmly without crushing. The teeth interlock when closed for secure grip.
instruments.handling_notes: Multiple tooth rows provide firm grip. Can cause tissue damage if used on delicate structures. Count teeth to identify size.

instruments.name: Babcock Tissue Forceps
instruments.description: Atraumatic tissue forceps with broad, smooth-tipped jaws. Designed to grasp delicate structures like fallopian tubes, bowel, and ureters without crushing.
instruments.handling_notes: Broad tips distribute pressure to minimize trauma. Do not use for clamping vessels. Standard length 6.25 inches.

instruments.name: Mayo Scissors - Straight
instruments.description: Heavy scissors with thick blades designed for cutting heavy tissue, fascia, and sutures. Straight blades provide precise cutting control for superficial dissection.
instruments.handling_notes: Thick blades require more force. Keep blades sharp. Standard length 6.75 inches. Not for delicate dissection.

instruments.name: Mayo Scissors - Curved
instruments.description: Heavy scissors with curved blades for dissecting in body cavities. The curve allows for cutting along tissue planes while maintaining visibility.
instruments.handling_notes: Curve tips away from critical structures. Use pushing motion for blunt dissection. Available in 6.75 and 9 inch lengths.

instruments.name: Metzenbaum Scissors
instruments.description: Delicate dissecting scissors with long shanks and relatively short blades. Designed for fine tissue dissection with minimal trauma.
instruments.handling_notes: Long handles for deep access. Use spreading motion for blunt dissection. Available in 5.5 to 9 inch lengths.

instruments.name: Iris Scissors
instruments.description: Small, sharp scissors with pointed tips. Originally designed for ophthalmic surgery but used widely for fine dissection and suture cutting.
instruments.handling_notes: Very sharp - handle with care. Tips are fragile. Standard length 4.5 inches. Straight and curved available.

instruments.name: Bandage Scissors
instruments.description: Scissors with one blunt tip angled to slide under bandages safely. The blunt lower blade prevents injury to the patient's skin.
instruments.handling_notes: Angle the blunt tip against the skin. Not for cutting tissue. Keep clean but not necessarily sterile for external use.

instruments.name: #10 Scalpel Blade
instruments.description: Large curved blade with a rounded belly. The most common general surgery blade, ideal for making long incisions through skin and subcutaneous tissue.
instruments.handling_notes: Mount on #3 handle. Use belly for long incisions, tip for precise cuts. Dispose in sharps container.

instruments.name: #15 Scalpel Blade
instruments.description: Small curved blade with a more pronounced point than the #10. Ideal for short, precise incisions and fine dissection work.
instruments.handling_notes: Mount on #3 handle. Better control than #10 for fine work. Popular for skin excisions and biopsies.

instruments.name: #11 Scalpel Blade
instruments.description: Triangular blade with a sharp pointed tip. Used for stab incisions, punctures, and precise cutting in tight spaces.
instruments.handling_notes: Very sharp point - high risk of needlestick. Use for stab wounds and punctures. Mount on #3 handle.

instruments.name: #3 Scalpel Handle
instruments.description: Standard scalpel handle that accepts #10, #11, #12, and #15 blades. Features a flat, balanced design for precise control.
instruments.handling_notes: Load and unload blades with needle holder or blade remover. Never use fingers. Reusable - must be sterilized.

instruments.name: #4 Scalpel Handle
instruments.description: Larger scalpel handle that accepts #20, #21, #22, #23, and #24 blades. Used when larger blades are needed for extensive incisions.
instruments.handling_notes: Larger grip than #3. Use for bigger blades and longer incisions. Load blades with needle holder.

instruments.name: Adson Tissue Forceps
instruments.description: Small thumb forceps with fine tips for grasping delicate tissue. Available with teeth (1x2 or 2x3) or serrated tips for different tissue types.
instruments.handling_notes: Toothed version for skin, serrated for delicate tissue. Hold like a pencil. Standard length 4.75 inches.

instruments.name: Debakey Tissue Forceps
instruments.description: Atraumatic tissue forceps with unique parallel serration pattern. Designed by Dr. Michael DeBakey for handling blood vessels without damage.
instruments.handling_notes: Unique serration pattern minimizes trauma. Available in various lengths (6-12 inches). Essential for vascular work.

instruments.name: Bonney Tissue Forceps
instruments.description: Heavy thumb forceps with large interlocking teeth (1x2). Designed for grasping dense tissue like fascia and uterus with a strong grip.
instruments.handling_notes: Large teeth can traumatize delicate tissue. Use only on fascia and dense structures. Length 7 inches.

instruments.name: Russian Tissue Forceps
instruments.description: Thumb forceps with circular, cup-shaped tips featuring interdigitating serrations. Provides strong grip without puncturing tissue.
instruments.handling_notes: Round tips prevent tissue puncture. Good for slippery tissue. Available in 6 and 8 inch lengths.

instruments.name: Army-Navy Retractor
instruments.description: Double-ended handheld retractor with different size blades on each end. A versatile, commonly used retractor for superficial wound retraction.
instruments.handling_notes: Two different blade sizes for versatility. Hand-held - requires assistant. Length 8.5 inches.

instruments.name: Richardson Retractor
instruments.description: Handheld retractor with a curved blade, commonly used for abdominal retraction. The slight curve helps retract deeper tissues.
instruments.handling_notes: Available in small, medium, and large sizes. Curved blade for deep retraction. Requires assistant to hold.

instruments.name: Deaver Retractor
instruments.description: Large, curved handheld retractor with a wide blade designed for retracting abdominal organs and providing deep exposure.
instruments.handling_notes: Wide blade for broad retraction. Multiple sizes (1-5). Use moist laparotomy sponge to protect organs.

instruments.name: Balfour Retractor
instruments.description: Self-retaining abdominal retractor with lateral blades and a central bladder blade. Provides hands-free exposure of the abdominal cavity.
instruments.handling_notes: Self-retaining via ratchet mechanism. Add bladder blade for deep pelvic work. Assemble before use.

instruments.name: Weitlaner Retractor
instruments.description: Self-retaining retractor with sharp or blunt prongs that interlock. Used for small wound retraction with hands-free operation.
instruments.handling_notes: Sharp prongs penetrate tissue for grip. Blunt version for delicate areas. Various sizes (4-8 inches).

instruments.name: Gelpi Retractor
instruments.description: Self-retaining retractor with single pointed prongs on each side. Commonly used in orthopedic and spinal surgery for muscle retraction.
instruments.handling_notes: Single sharp point penetrates muscle. Position carefully to avoid nerve damage. Available in various sizes.

instruments.name: Senn Retractor
instruments.description: Double-ended handheld retractor with a three-pronged rake on one end and a curved blade on the other. Versatile for superficial retraction.
instruments.handling_notes: Sharp rake end for skin, blade end for soft tissue. Small size (6 inches) for delicate work.

instruments.name: Roux Retractor
instruments.description: Double-ended handheld retractor with broad blades of different widths. Used for retracting wound edges in deeper incisions.
instruments.handling_notes: Two blade sizes offer flexibility. Smooth edges minimize tissue trauma. Length 6 inches.

instruments.name: Ribbon Retractor
instruments.description: Flexible metal ribbon that can be bent to desired shape. Conforms to anatomy for customized retraction in deep cavities.
instruments.handling_notes: Bend to desired shape before inserting. Available in various widths (1-3 inches). Protect with moist sponge.

instruments.name: Mayo-Hegar Needle Holder
instruments.description: Standard needle holder with cross-serrated jaws for secure needle grip. The most commonly used needle holder in general surgery.
instruments.handling_notes: Match size to needle - 6 inch for small needles, 8 inch for larger. Grip needle at 1/3 from swaged end.

instruments.name: Crile-Wood Needle Holder
instruments.description: Needle holder similar to Mayo-Hegar but with a narrower jaw profile. Good for medium-sized needles and general suturing.
instruments.handling_notes: Narrower than Mayo-Hegar, better for medium needles. Standard lengths 6 and 7 inches.

instruments.name: Webster Needle Holder
instruments.description: Delicate needle holder with smooth jaws, designed for fine needles and microsurgical work. Provides gentle grip without crushing small needles.
instruments.handling_notes: Smooth jaws for fine needles only. Will slip on large needles. Standard length 5 inches.

instruments.name: Castroviejo Needle Holder
instruments.description: Precision micro needle holder with locking mechanism and tungsten carbide inserts. Designed for microsurgery and ophthalmic procedures.
instruments.handling_notes: Lock mechanism holds position. TC inserts grip fine needles. Use only for microsurgery. Length 5.5 inches.

instruments.name: Suture Scissors
instruments.description: Small scissors designed specifically for cutting suture material. Often have a hook on one blade to lift and cut sutures.
instruments.handling_notes: Do not use for tissue dissection. Keep separate from other scissors. Hook blade for suture removal.

instruments.name: Grooved Director
instruments.description: Probe with a longitudinal groove used to guide cutting instruments. Protects underlying structures while dissecting or incising.
instruments.handling_notes: Insert grooved side facing cutting direction. Groove guides knife or scissors safely.

instruments.name: Lacrimal Probe
instruments.description: Fine, flexible probe used to explore and dilate the lacrimal duct system. Double-ended with different sized tips.
instruments.handling_notes: Very delicate - do not force. Graduated sizes (0000 to 8). Lubricate before insertion.

instruments.name: Hegar Dilators
instruments.description: Set of graduated dilators used to progressively dilate the cervical canal. Double-ended with sequential sizes.
instruments.handling_notes: Progress through sizes gradually. Double-ended saves instrument changes. Sizes 1-18 typically in set.

instruments.name: Van Buren Sounds
instruments.description: Curved metal dilators for urethral dilation and calibration. The curve follows the natural anatomy of the male urethra.
instruments.handling_notes: Follow anatomic curve gently. Never force. Lubricate well. Sizes in French gauge.

instruments.name: Towel Clamp
instruments.description: Penetrating clamp with sharp points used to secure surgical drapes to each other and to the patient. Creates a sterile field boundary.
instruments.handling_notes: Sharp points penetrate drapes and skin. Count at end of procedure. Can mark incision sites.

instruments.name: Sponge Forceps
instruments.description: Ring-handled forceps with oval, serrated jaws used to hold sponges. Also used for atraumatic grasping of tissue and packing.
instruments.handling_notes: Load sponge securely in jaws. Use for prep without gloves contamination. 9.5 inch standard length.

instruments.name: Yankauer Suction Tip
instruments.description: Rigid suction tip with a bulbous end and multiple small holes. Designed to prevent tissue damage while suctioning fluids.
instruments.handling_notes: Multiple holes prevent tissue plugging. Rigid design for controlled suction. Disposable or reusable versions.

instruments.name: Poole Suction Tip
instruments.description: Two-piece suction tip with outer sheath containing multiple holes. Designed for rapid evacuation of large fluid volumes from body cavities.
instruments.handling_notes: Outer guard distributes suction. Remove guard for direct suction. Connect to high-volume suction.

instruments.name: Frazier Suction Tip
instruments.description: Small-diameter suction tube with finger control vent. Allows precise suction control for delicate procedures and small spaces.
instruments.handling_notes: Finger over vent for suction, release to stop. Available in French sizes 3-12. Style with and without stylet.

instruments.name: Bovie Electrocautery Pencil
instruments.description: Handheld electrosurgical device that uses electrical current to cut tissue and coagulate blood vessels. Essential for hemostasis.
instruments.handling_notes: Requires grounding pad. Cut mode for incision, coag for hemostasis. Keep tip clean. Fire hazard in presence of oxygen.

instruments.name: Harmonic Scalpel
instruments.description: Ultrasonic surgical device that vibrates at 55,000 Hz to simultaneously cut and coagulate tissue with minimal lateral thermal damage.
instruments.handling_notes: Blade heats during use - allow to cool. Seals vessels up to 5mm. Requires dedicated generator.

instruments.name: LigaSure Vessel Sealing Device
instruments.description: Bipolar electrosurgical device that combines pressure and energy to seal vessels and tissue bundles. Provides consistent seal strength.
instruments.handling_notes: Seals vessels up to 7mm. Built-in blade for cutting. Requires specific generator. Multiple jaw configurations.

instruments.name: Laparoscopic Grasper
instruments.description: Long-shafted instrument for grasping and manipulating tissue during laparoscopic surgery. Various jaw configurations available.
instruments.handling_notes: 5mm and 10mm diameters common. Variety of jaw types. Insulated shaft for use with electrocautery.

instruments.name: Laparoscopic Scissors
instruments.description: Long-shafted scissors for cutting tissue during laparoscopic procedures. Often connected to electrocautery for coagulation cutting.
instruments.handling_notes: Curved and straight tips available. Can connect to monopolar cautery. Check tip alignment before use.

instruments.name: Veress Needle
instruments.description: Spring-loaded needle used to establish pneumoperitoneum for laparoscopic surgery. Safety mechanism retracts sharp tip when through peritoneum.
instruments.handling_notes: Test spring mechanism before use. Insert at 45-degree angle. Confirm intraperitoneal placement. Disposable preferred.

instruments.name: Trocar 5mm
instruments.description: Cylindrical port with sharp obturator for abdominal wall penetration. Creates working channel for 5mm laparoscopic instruments.
instruments.handling_notes: Sharp obturator removed after placement. Seal maintains pneumoperitoneum. Various lengths available.

instruments.name: Trocar 10/12mm
instruments.description: Larger port for camera insertion and specimen extraction. Accepts 10mm laparoscope and allows removal of larger tissue specimens.
instruments.handling_notes: Requires fascial closure due to size. Often placed at umbilicus. Multiple seal designs available.

instruments.name: Laparoscopic Clip Applier
instruments.description: Instrument that applies titanium or polymer clips to seal vessels and ducts during laparoscopic procedures. Essential for gallbladder surgery.
instruments.handling_notes: Verify clip closure before firing. Multiple sizes (small, medium, large). Count clips used vs remaining.

instruments.name: Endoscopic Linear Stapler
instruments.description: Laparoscopic stapling device that places multiple rows of staples while cutting between them. Used for tissue transection and anastomosis.
instruments.handling_notes: Various staple heights for tissue thickness. Reload cartridges available. Ensure complete firing before release.

instruments.name: Skin Stapler
instruments.description: Disposable device that applies stainless steel staples for rapid skin closure. Faster than traditional suturing for long incisions.
instruments.handling_notes: Evert skin edges before stapling. Space staples 5-10mm apart. Requires staple remover for removal.

instruments.name: Bone Curette
instruments.description: Spoon-shaped instrument for scraping and removing bone, tissue, or debris. Available in various sizes and angles.
instruments.handling_notes: Scoop away from critical structures. Various sizes and angles. Angled for reaching around corners.

instruments.name: Periosteal Elevator
instruments.description: Flat-bladed instrument for lifting periosteum from bone surface. Essential for exposing bone in orthopedic and neurosurgical procedures.
instruments.handling_notes: Keep blade against bone to preserve periosteum. Various widths available. Cobb elevator for spine.

instruments.name: Rongeur
instruments.description: Biting forceps used to remove small pieces of bone. Spring-loaded handles allow repetitive biting action. Various sizes and angles.
instruments.handling_notes: Bite small amounts at a time. Keep sharp for clean cuts. Kerrison for lamina, Leksell for larger bites.

instruments.name: Bone Holding Forceps
instruments.description: Strong forceps designed to grasp and hold bone fragments during reduction and fixation. Various jaw configurations for different bones.
instruments.handling_notes: Match forceps to bone size. Point reduction clamps for small fragments. Speed lock for maintaining position.

instruments.name: Osteotome
instruments.description: Chisel-like instrument for cutting or shaping bone. Used with a mallet to create controlled bone cuts or osteotomies.
instruments.handling_notes: Keep sharp for clean cuts. Use mallet, not hammer. Various widths. Guard hand position.

instruments.name: Gigli Saw
instruments.description: Flexible wire saw used to cut bone. Passed around bone and pulled back and forth in sawing motion. Used when power saws cannot access.
instruments.handling_notes: Attach handles to each end. Saw with steady rhythm. Protect soft tissue during sawing. Single use.

instruments.name: Sagittal Saw
instruments.description: Powered surgical saw with blade that oscillates side-to-side. Used for precise bone cuts in orthopedic and neurosurgical procedures.
instruments.handling_notes: Oscillating motion reduces soft tissue damage. Various blade sizes. Requires compressed nitrogen or battery.

instruments.name: Surgical Power Drill
instruments.description: Powered rotary drill for creating holes in bone for screws, pins, and wires. Essential for internal fixation of fractures.
instruments.handling_notes: Use appropriate bit size. Irrigate to prevent thermal necrosis. Forward and reverse capability.

instruments.name: Kirschner Wire
instruments.description: Thin, stiff wire used for temporary or permanent fixation of bone fragments. Available in various diameters. Often used with power drill.
instruments.handling_notes: Trocar and diamond tips available. Cut to length with wire cutter. Bend end to prevent migration.

instruments.name: Bone Screw
instruments.description: Specialized screws for bone fixation. Cortical screws for dense bone, cancellous for softer bone. Various lengths and diameters.
instruments.handling_notes: Match screw type to bone quality. Measure depth before insertion. Self-tapping vs non-self-tapping.

instruments.name: Bone Plate
instruments.description: Metal plate attached to bone with screws for fracture stabilization. Various designs for different fracture patterns and locations.
instruments.handling_notes: Contour to bone shape. Locking plates for osteoporotic bone. Count all screws placed.

instruments.name: Wire Cutter
instruments.description: Heavy-duty cutting tool designed to cut K-wires, cerclage wire, and pins. Hardened jaws to cut through metal without dulling.
instruments.handling_notes: Cut perpendicular to wire. Protect eyes and field from flying fragments. Various sizes for different wire gauges.

instruments.name: Tenaculum
instruments.description: Sharp, single-toothed instrument for grasping and manipulating the cervix. Provides secure grip for cervical procedures.
instruments.handling_notes: Sharp tooth penetrates cervix - warn patient of cramping. Straight and angled versions. Single or double tooth.

instruments.name: Uterine Sound
instruments.description: Graduated metal probe for measuring uterine cavity depth and confirming uterine position. Essential before uterine procedures.
instruments.handling_notes: Note depth in centimeters. Feel for resistance. Never force. Maleable tip follows uterine curve.

instruments.name: Graves Speculum
instruments.description: Two-bladed instrument for vaginal examination. Opens to expose vaginal walls and cervix. Duckbill shape with screw lock.
instruments.handling_notes: Warm before insertion. Various sizes (Pederson narrower). Open gently. Screw lock maintains position.

instruments.name: Uterine Manipulator
instruments.description: Device inserted into uterus during laparoscopic surgery to manipulate uterine position. Aids in visualization and dissection.
instruments.handling_notes: Insert after dilating cervix. Various tips available. RUMI has colpotomy cup. Requires assistant control.

instruments.name: Satinsky Clamp
instruments.description: Angled vascular clamp that partially occludes a vessel while allowing continued blood flow. Used for side-to-side anastomosis.
instruments.handling_notes: Atraumatic serrations protect vessel. Angled jaws for access. Various sizes. Apply gently.

instruments.name: Bulldog Clamp
instruments.description: Small, spring-loaded clamp for temporary vessel occlusion. Quick application and removal. Atraumatic design.
instruments.handling_notes: Count all bulldogs applied. Spring tension varies by size. Micro version for small vessels.

instruments.name: Potts Scissors
instruments.description: Angled vascular scissors designed for precise cuts in blood vessels. The 45-degree angle allows for controlled arteriotomy.
instruments.handling_notes: Very sharp - handle with care. 45 and 60 degree angles available. Fine tips for precise cuts.

instruments.name: Castro-Viejo Scissors
instruments.description: Delicate spring-action scissors for microsurgical and ophthalmic procedures. Very fine tips for precise cutting.
instruments.handling_notes: Spring action for fine control. Extremely sharp. Handle with care. Various tip configurations.

instruments.name: Tonsil Forceps
instruments.description: Curved forceps with serrated jaws for grasping tonsil tissue during tonsillectomy. Fenestrated or solid jaws available.
instruments.handling_notes: Fenestrated version allows tissue visualization. Curved for access to tonsillar fossa. Length 7.5 inches.

instruments.name: Adenoid Curette
instruments.description: Curved instrument with sharp basket-like end for removing adenoid tissue. Inserted through mouth to nasopharynx.
instruments.handling_notes: Various sizes for patient anatomy. Sharp edge faces tissue. Use with mirror visualization.

instruments.name: Nasal Speculum
instruments.description: Self-retaining speculum for opening and examining nasal passages. Spring-loaded blades hold nostrils open for inspection.
instruments.handling_notes: Various blade lengths and widths. Vienna style most common. Do not overextend nostrils.

instruments.name: Ear Speculum
instruments.description: Cone-shaped instrument inserted into ear canal for examination. Various sizes to fit different ear canal diameters.
instruments.handling_notes: Select size appropriate for canal. Do not insert too deeply. Disposable and reusable versions.

instruments.name: Mastoid Retractor
instruments.description: Self-retaining retractor for mastoid and ear surgery. Holds wound edges open during delicate temporal bone procedures.
instruments.handling_notes: Blunt or sharp prongs available. Small size for limited working space. Position carefully to avoid nerve damage.

instruments.name: House Curette
instruments.description: Delicate, angled curette for ear surgery. Used to remove tissue and bone in the middle ear and mastoid.
instruments.handling_notes: Various sizes and angles. Very delicate - handle with care. Sharp edge for tissue removal.

instruments.name: Myringotomy Knife
instruments.description: Small, angled blade for incising the tympanic membrane. Used to create opening for fluid drainage or tube placement.
instruments.handling_notes: Extremely sharp. Make controlled radial incision. Disposable preferred for sharpness.

instruments.name: Skin Hook
instruments.description: Small hook for retracting skin edges with minimal trauma. Single or double hooks available. Essential for plastic surgery.
instruments.handling_notes: Sharp - handle carefully. Single hook for edges, double for broader retraction. Do not pull forcefully.

instruments.name: Rake Retractor
instruments.description: Handheld retractor with multiple prongs (usually 3-6) for retracting wound edges. Prongs may be sharp or blunt.
instruments.handling_notes: Sharp prongs penetrate tissue. Blunt for delicate areas. Various prong counts. Hand-held.

instruments.name: Freeman Areola Marker
instruments.description: Circular device for marking symmetric areola circles in breast surgery. Available in various diameters for different areola sizes.
instruments.handling_notes: Select appropriate diameter. Use with marking pen. Sterilize before use.

instruments.name: Breast Retractor
instruments.description: Wide retractor designed for breast surgery exposure. May have fiber optic illumination for cavity visualization.
instruments.handling_notes: Lighted versions require fiber optic cable. Wide blade for pocket visualization. Various sizes.

instruments.name: Dermatome
instruments.description: Powered instrument for harvesting split-thickness skin grafts. Adjustable width and thickness settings for precise graft harvesting.
instruments.handling_notes: Set thickness precisely (typically 0.008-0.012 inches). Use mineral oil on skin. Requires blade replacement.

instruments.name: Mesh Graft Expander
instruments.description: Device that cuts multiple slits in skin graft, allowing it to expand and cover larger wound area. Various expansion ratios available.
instruments.handling_notes: Place graft on carrier. Select expansion ratio (1:1.5 to 1:9). Pass through mesher evenly.

instruments.name: Needle Counter
instruments.description: Foam or magnetic board for organizing and counting needles during surgery. Essential for sharps count verification.
instruments.handling_notes: Count needles onto board. Verify counts at case end. Some have magnetic backing. Document any discrepancies.

instruments.name: Raytec Sponge
instruments.description: Radiopaque gauze sponge with X-ray detectable strip. Standard 4x4 inch size. Used for absorption and packing in surgical field.
instruments.handling_notes: Always count. Never cut on field. X-ray marker visible on film if retained. Bundle of 10 for counting.

instruments.name: Laparotomy Sponge
instruments.description: Large radiopaque sponge for abdominal procedures. Highly absorbent for blood and irrigation fluid. Has X-ray detectable marker.
instruments.handling_notes: Always count. Moisten before use near organs. Blue indicator highly visible. Never leave unaccounted.

instruments.name: Peanut Dissector
instruments.description: Small, tightly rolled gauze mounted on a clamp. Used for blunt dissection and tissue spreading. Named for its peanut-like shape.
instruments.handling_notes: Mount securely on forceps. Use gentle spreading motion. Count as sponge. May have X-ray marker.

instruments.name: Cottonoid Patty
instruments.description: Small, soft cotton pad with radiopaque marker and string. Used in neurosurgery to protect brain tissue and absorb fluids.
instruments.handling_notes: Moisten before use. Leave strings outside wound. Count all patties. Various sizes available.

instruments.name: Penrose Drain
instruments.description: Soft, flat latex rubber tube used for passive wound drainage. Also used as a vessel loop retractor during surgery.
instruments.handling_notes: Various widths (1/4 to 1 inch). Use as retractor around vessels. Secure with safety pin when draining.

instruments.name: Jackson-Pratt Drain
instruments.description: Closed-suction drain with flat, perforated silicone tube connected to a bulb reservoir. Provides continuous suction for wound drainage.
instruments.handling_notes: Compress bulb to create suction. Empty and measure output. Secure tube to skin.

instruments.name: Hemovac Drain
instruments.description: High-capacity closed-suction drain for larger volume drainage. Accordion-style reservoir creates suction. Common in orthopedic surgery.
instruments.handling_notes: Compress accordion to create suction. Higher volume than JP. Monitor for excessive output.

instruments.name: Chest Tube
instruments.description: Large-bore tube inserted into pleural space for drainage of air, blood, or fluid. Connected to underwater seal drainage system.
instruments.handling_notes: Size in French (20-40 typical adult). Connect to water seal. Never clamp unless directed. Monitor for air leak.

instruments.name: Foley Catheter
instruments.description: Retention catheter with inflatable balloon for continuous bladder drainage. Various sizes and balloon volumes available.
instruments.handling_notes: Sterile insertion technique. Test balloon before insertion. Size in French (14-18 typical adult).

instruments.name: Suction Canister
instruments.description: Container for collecting suctioned fluids during surgery. Graduated markings for measuring blood loss. Connected to wall suction.
instruments.handling_notes: Note volume before irrigation. Calculate blood loss. Replace when full. Solidifier may be added.

instruments.name: Light Handle Cover
instruments.description: Sterile disposable cover for operating room light handles. Allows sterile team members to adjust surgical lighting.
instruments.handling_notes: Apply before surgery. Change if contaminated. Maintains sterility of light controls.

instruments.name: Marking Pen
instruments.description: Sterile pen with non-toxic ink for marking surgical sites and incision lines. Ink persists through skin prep.
instruments.handling_notes: Mark before prep. Violet ink standard. Verify site marking protocol. Patient may initial.

instruments.name: Stomach Tube
instruments.description: Tube inserted through nose into stomach for decompression and drainage. Salem sump has air vent to prevent mucosal damage.
instruments.handling_notes: Confirm placement before use. Blue pigtail is air vent - keep open. Sizes in French.

instruments.name: Bone Wax
instruments.description: Non-absorbable wax applied to bleeding bone surfaces for hemostasis. Made from beeswax and softening agents.
instruments.handling_notes: Soften between fingers before applying. Press firmly into bone. Foreign body - use minimally.

instruments.name: Gelfoam
instruments.description: Absorbable gelatin sponge for hemostasis. Can be soaked in thrombin for enhanced effect. Absorbs in 4-6 weeks.
instruments.handling_notes: Soak in saline or thrombin. Apply with pressure. Do not overfill wound. Absorbable.

instruments.name: Surgicel
instruments.description: Absorbable hemostatic material made from oxidized regenerated cellulose. Provides hemostasis through mechanical and chemical action.
instruments.handling_notes: Apply dry, do not wet. Layers on tissue. Absorbs in 7-14 days. May interfere with nerve regeneration.

instruments.name: Hemostatic Clip
instruments.description: Small titanium or polymer clips for ligating vessels and ducts. Applied with clip applier. Various sizes for different structures.
instruments.handling_notes: Match clip size to structure. Verify complete closure. Count all clips. MRI compatible varies.

instruments.name: Bipolar Forceps
instruments.description: Forceps that deliver bipolar electrical current between two tips for precise coagulation. Current stays between tips for safety.
instruments.handling_notes: No grounding pad needed. Irrigate tips to prevent sticking. Various tip configurations.

instruments.name: Hemoclip Applier
instruments.description: Instrument for applying hemostatic clips to vessels and ducts. Spring-loaded mechanism for controlled clip application.
instruments.handling_notes: Load clip before placing on structure. Check clip engagement. Count clips used vs loaded.

instruments.name: Argon Beam Coagulator
instruments.description: Electrosurgical device that uses argon gas to deliver electrical current for superficial coagulation. Provides uniform hemostasis.
instruments.handling_notes: Non-contact coagulation. Argon is inert but can cause gas embolism. Requires dedicated generator.

instruments.name: Skin Graft Knife
instruments.description: Long-handled knife with adjustable blade for harvesting skin grafts by hand. Alternative to powered dermatome for small grafts.
instruments.handling_notes: Adjust blade depth setting. Use steady, even pressure. Lubricate skin before harvesting.

instruments.name: Vessel Loop
instruments.description: Soft silastic or cotton loop for encircling and retracting vessels and structures. Color-coded for identification.
instruments.handling_notes: Pass around structure with right angle. Colors: red (artery), blue (vein), white (nerve), yellow (other).

instruments.name: Right Angle Clamp
instruments.description: Forceps with jaws angled at 90 degrees for dissecting around and passing ties behind structures. Essential for vessel isolation.
instruments.handling_notes: Various lengths and angles. Fine tip for delicate dissection. Pass ties through jaws.

instruments.name: Schnidt Forceps
instruments.description: Hemostatic forceps with a gentle curve and fully serrated jaws. Used for clamping in areas requiring slight angulation.
instruments.handling_notes: Gentler curve than right angle. Full serrations for secure grip. Standard 7.25 inch length.

instruments.name: Lahey Forceps
instruments.description: Forceps with sharp teeth at tips for grasping thyroid and other dense tissue. Designed for secure tissue manipulation.
instruments.handling_notes: Teeth can be traumatic to delicate tissue. Use on fascia and dense structures only.

instruments.name: Pennington Forceps
instruments.description: Atraumatic forceps with triangular, fenestrated tips. Provides secure grip on bowel and other hollow organs without crushing.
instruments.handling_notes: Fenestrated tips prevent slipping. Do not use on mesentery. Various sizes available.

instruments.name: Duval Lung Forceps
instruments.description: Triangular-tipped forceps designed for grasping lung tissue atraumatically. Wider tip distributes pressure to prevent tearing.
instruments.handling_notes: Wide tip for delicate lung tissue. Do not crush. Handle gently to prevent air leak.

instruments.name: Satin Sky Vascular Clamp
instruments.description: Curved vascular clamp for partially occluding large vessels like the aorta. Allows side-biting while maintaining flow.
instruments.handling_notes: Atraumatic jaws protect vessel wall. Various sizes and angles. Apply and remove gently.

instruments.name: Fogarty Balloon Catheter
instruments.description: Catheter with inflatable balloon at tip for removing blood clots from arteries. Passed beyond clot, inflated, and withdrawn.
instruments.handling_notes: Test balloon before insertion. Various sizes (2-7 French). Gentle withdrawal to avoid intimal damage.

instruments.name: Cooley Clamp
instruments.description: Atraumatic vascular clamp designed by Dr. Denton Cooley for cardiac surgery. Various configurations for different vessels.
instruments.handling_notes: Extremely atraumatic design. Multiple configurations. Handle with care. Apply minimum pressure.

instruments.name: Sternal Saw
instruments.description: Powered saw for performing median sternotomy in cardiac surgery. Oscillating blade divides sternum safely.
instruments.handling_notes: Keep saw centered on sternum. Lift up while cutting. Protect underlying structures. Requires specialized blade.

instruments.name: Sternal Retractor
instruments.description: Large self-retaining retractor for spreading sternum after sternotomy. Provides exposure of mediastinum and heart.
instruments.handling_notes: Open gradually to prevent sternal fracture. Pad edges to prevent brachial plexus injury.

instruments.name: Sternal Wire
instruments.description: Heavy-gauge stainless steel wire for closing sternotomy. Provides strong approximation for bone healing.
instruments.handling_notes: Figure-of-eight or interrupted technique. Twist until tight. Cut ends and bend flat. Count all wires.

instruments.name: Internal Defibrillator Paddles
instruments.description: Sterile paddles for direct cardiac defibrillation during open-chest surgery. Requires lower energy than external pads.
instruments.handling_notes: Use 10-30 joules internally (vs 200-360 externally). Irrigate with saline. Clear before shocking.

instruments.name: Snare
instruments.description: Wire loop that can be tightened to transect or retrieve tissue. Used in various specialties for polyp removal and retrieval.
instruments.handling_notes: Deploy loop around target. Tighten gradually. May connect to electrosurgery. Various loop sizes.

instruments.name: Rumel Tourniquet
instruments.description: Device for temporary vessel occlusion using umbilical tape or vessel loop passed through rubber tubing and secured with a clamp.
instruments.handling_notes: Pass tape around vessel, through tubing. Secure with hemostat. Release carefully when done.

instruments.name: Beaver Blade Handle
instruments.description: Small, pencil-like handle designed for microsurgical blades. Allows precise control for fine cutting and dissection.
instruments.handling_notes: Accepts various micro blade shapes. Hold like pencil for control. Very sharp blades.

instruments.name: Czerny Retractor
instruments.description: Double-ended vaginal retractor with blades of different sizes. Provides exposure during vaginal surgical procedures.
instruments.handling_notes: Two different size blades. Smooth edges protect vaginal mucosa. Requires assistant.

instruments.name: Heaney Clamp
instruments.description: Heavy, curved clamp designed for clamping uterine vessels and pedicles during hysterectomy. Strong jaws with horizontal serrations.
instruments.handling_notes: Heavy construction for thick tissue. Curved jaw follows pelvic anatomy. Count serrations to identify size.

instruments.name: O'Sullivan-O'Connor Retractor
instruments.description: Self-retaining retractor for abdominal and pelvic surgery. Interchangeable blades accommodate different incision sizes.
instruments.handling_notes: Multiple blade options. Ratchet mechanism for self-retention. Popular for C-sections.

instruments.name: Bookwalter Retractor
instruments.description: Comprehensive table-mounted retractor system with multiple adjustable arms and blade options. Provides hands-free exposure.
instruments.handling_notes: Mount to OR table rail. Multiple blade configurations. Adjust as needed during case. Team must be careful when moving.

instruments.name: Thompson Retractor
instruments.description: Table-mounted retractor system similar to Bookwalter. Provides stable, adjustable retraction for complex procedures.
instruments.handling_notes: Heavy-duty construction. Multiple arm positions. Requires dedicated post and clamp system.

instruments.name: Babcock-Vital Retractor
instruments.description: Small handheld retractor ideal for appendectomy and other limited exposures. Narrow blade fits small incisions.
instruments.handling_notes: Narrow profile for small incisions. Smooth blade edge. Requires assistant to hold.

instruments.name: Morris Retractor
instruments.description: Large, handheld retractor with wide blade for deep abdominal retraction. Commonly used in open abdominal surgery.
instruments.handling_notes: Wide blade for maximum retraction. Requires strong assistant. Pad with moist sponge.

instruments.name: Harrington Retractor
instruments.description: Heart-shaped blade for retracting liver and other solid organs. Smooth surface prevents organ damage.
instruments.handling_notes: Smooth, heart-shaped blade. Various sizes. Use moist sponge for padding. Gentle retraction.

instruments.name: Fan Retractor
instruments.description: Laparoscopic retractor with expandable fan blade. Provides broad retraction through small port incision.
instruments.handling_notes: Deploy fan inside abdomen. Triangular or fan shape. Useful for liver retraction in lap chole.

instruments.name: Endoscopic Camera
instruments.description: Optical instrument for visualizing body cavities during minimally invasive surgery. Available in 0, 30, and 45 degree angles.
instruments.handling_notes: Connect to camera head and light source. Anti-fog before insertion. Handle lens end with care.

instruments.name: Light Cord
instruments.description: Fiber optic cable that transmits light from light source to endoscope or retractor. Essential for endoscopic visualization.
instruments.handling_notes: Avoid kinking cable. Do not coil tightly. Check for broken fibers. Connect securely to scope.

instruments.name: Camera Head
instruments.description: Digital camera unit that attaches to endoscope to capture and transmit surgical video to monitors.
instruments.handling_notes: White balance before use. Attach securely to scope. Keep lens clean. Sterilized or draped.

instruments.name: Insufflator Tubing
instruments.description: Sterile tubing connecting insufflator to trocar for CO2 delivery during laparoscopic surgery.
instruments.handling_notes: Connect to gas inlet on trocar. Sterile field connection. Check for kinks during case.

instruments.name: Bipolar Vessel Sealer
instruments.description: Advanced bipolar device that seals vessels up to 7mm and tissue bundles. Combines sealing and cutting in one device.
instruments.handling_notes: Complete seal cycle before cutting. Various jaw configurations. Requires specific generator.

instruments.name: Specimen Retrieval Bag
instruments.description: Deployable bag for containing and removing specimens during laparoscopic surgery. Prevents spillage and wound contamination.
instruments.handling_notes: Deploy bag, place specimen inside, cinch closed. Remove through port site. Various sizes.

instruments.name: Port Closure Device
instruments.description: Device for closing fascia at trocar sites larger than 10mm to prevent incisional hernia.
instruments.handling_notes: Use for ports 10mm and larger. Pass suture through fascia. Various techniques available.

instruments.name: Step Reducer
instruments.description: Cap that reduces trocar diameter, allowing smaller instruments through larger ports.
instruments.handling_notes: Reduces 12mm port to 5mm. Maintains pneumoperitoneum seal. Snap-on application.

instruments.name: Knot Pusher
instruments.description: Long instrument for pushing and securing knots during laparoscopic suturing. Slides suture loops to tissue.
instruments.handling_notes: Use with extracorporeal knot technique. Various tip designs. Push knot firmly to tissue.

instruments.name: Endoscopic Suturing Device
instruments.description: Device that facilitates suturing during laparoscopic surgery by passing and receiving a needle between two jaws.
instruments.handling_notes: Toggle mechanism passes needle between jaws. Use with specific needle. Curved or straight designs.

instruments.name: Endoscopic Kittner
instruments.description: Laparoscopic instrument holding a peanut sponge for blunt dissection during minimally invasive surgery.
instruments.handling_notes: Replace peanut when soiled. Use gentle spreading technique. Count as sponge.
